discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The exhibit shows the audio bandwidth between Site A and Site B is set to 320 kbps.
For G.711 calls, each call consumes approximately 80 kbps of bandwidth (64 kbps for payload and an additional ~16 kbps for overhead). This means:

Maximum calls supported=Audio Bandwidth/Bandwidth per G.711 call=320/80=4 calls

The fifth call cannot be established because the Audio Bandwidth value is undersized and must be set to at least 400 kbps to support five concurrent G.711 calls.

choices.A: The G.729 audio codec is negotiated between Site A and B instead of the G.711 codec.
choices.B: The QoS configuration on the WAN link causes the fifth call to be dropped.
choices.C: Cisco UCM is using alternative links because of the Weight value.
choices.D: The Audio Bandwidth value is undersized and mist be set to 400 kbps.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer deploys CAC to Cisco UCM. Up to five G.711 calls must be supported on the WAN link between Site A and Site B. Users report that only four concurrent calls are possible between Site A and Site B. Why isn't the fifth concurrent call successful?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Hard to say which one as both B. and D. are correct, however D. is safer, but cause more network traffic.

choices.D: Choose "Send PRACK for all 1xx Messages" in the SIP profile.
choices.B: Choose "Send PRACK" if 1xx contains SDP in the SIP profile.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Calls from users to the PSTN in an organization get disconnected with a 408 Request Timeout when the called party is unavailable to pick up the call. Which solution must be used to resolve this challenge?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Check with GPT

choices.A: Disable SIP User Agent bind status (media).
choices.C: Disable SIP early-media for 180 responses with SDP.
choices.B: Decrease the SIP max-forwards value to 16.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer deploys a Cisco Unified Border Element for SIP trunk interconnection to an ITSP. The engineer performs test calls but there is no audio when the called party picks up the phone. What must the engineer do to resolve the issue?

choices.C: Enable password-based authentication in conjunction with certificate-based authentication.
choices.D: Ensure that the cluster ID for all clusters is the same.
choices.E: Install multiserver CA-signed CallManager certificates on all cluster publishers.
choices.B: Install multiserver CA-signed Tomcat certificates on all cluster publishers.
choices.A: Set all clusters to standalone on the ILS configuration page.

questions.question_text: An administrator is configuring an Intercluster Lookup Service between 10 Cisco UCM clusters. Due to security requirements, certificate-based authentication must be used. Due to the deployment size, the administrator wants to avoid manually exchanging certificates between the clusters. Which two steps must be followed to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
A. Set all clusters to standalone on the ILS configuration page.

Incorrect because ILS clusters should be in hub-and-spoke or full-mesh topology, not standalone.
Standalone mode disables intercluster communication.
❌ C. Enable password-based authentication in conjunction with certificate-based authentication.

Incorrect because if certificate-based authentication is required for security, password-based authentication is not needed.
❌ D. Ensure that the cluster ID for all clusters is the same.

Incorrect because each UCM cluster must have a unique cluster ID to avoid conflicts in ILS routing.

Selected Answer: BC
B. Install multiserver CA-signed Tomcat certificates on all cluster publishers.
Tomcat certificates are required for secure HTTPS communication between UCM clusters in ILS. Using multiserver CA-signed certificates ensures security without requiring manual certificate exchange.
C. Enable password-based authentication in conjunction with certificate-based authentication.
Password-based authentication works alongside certificate-based authentication to simplify the process of setting up secure communication between clusters, avoiding the need for manual intervention.

Selected Answer: C
voice service voip
 sip
 dtmf-relay rtp-nte
!
dial-peer voice 100 voip
 destination-pattern 10-digit-pattern
 session protocol sipv2
 session target ipv4:<ITSP-IP-ADDRESS>
 dtmf-relay rtp-nte
 voice-class sip dtmf-relay force rtp-nte
 codec g711ulaw

questions.question_text: An engineer is configuring a Cisco Unified Border Element. The SIP ITSP requires a DNIS of 10-digits and DTMF tones sent in the RTP stream on the outbound leg of a call. Which code completes this configuration?
